summary: This is an arrest warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York for Ghislaine Maxwell. It commands law enforcement to arrest her based on an indictment charging conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury. The warrant was issued by Magistrate Judge Lisa Margaret Smith in White Plains, NY.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual named in the arrest warrant, accused of conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury.

persons.name: Lisa Margaret Smith
persons.context: The issuing officer who signed the arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Issuance of Arrest Warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A U.S. magistrate judge issued an arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell based on an indictment charging her with multiple federal crimes related to the sexual exploitation of minors.

keyFacts: An arrest warrant was issued for Ghislaine Maxwell on June 29, 2020.

The warrant was based on an indictment charging violations of Title 18, U.S. Code, including conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury.
The warrant was issued by U.S. Magistrate Judge Lisa Margaret Smith in White Plains, NY.
The document is a formal court command for law enforcement to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell.
The case is identified as being in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York.
